message.content: Symphyotrichum ericoides is a species of perennial herbaceous plant in the Asteraceae family. Its common name is heath aster. This plant typically grows to a height of 3 feet and has a spread of about 1-2 feet. The flowers are small, white or lavender, with yellow centers, and grow in clusters at the ends of the stems. The leaves are narrow and needle-like, with a slightly rough texture. It is typically found in wetlands, meadows, and prairies throughout much of North America. It is also cultivated as an ornamental plant. The Symphyotrichum ericoides plant has a delicate appearance and its overall impression is of a rounded, airy bush.
